result.execSummary:
The defendant Corren D Mattox was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Attempt Armed Robbery [Modifiers: Party to a Crime], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Pay all costs, fees and surcharges.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay wil result in a civil judgment.
**Restitution set at zero.

**Per Order dated 7/16/15, Judgment of Conviction amended to clarify that the defendant was convicted in this case of felony murder under section 940.03, Stats., with attempted armed robbery, party to a crime, as the predicate offense.**
**11-10-16/Sentence of February 19, 2015 MODIFIED as follows: Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 YEARS, with credit for 310 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 13 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 11 YEARS. All other conditions to remain as ordered on February 19, 2015 and entered into the record on that date.

superMiscConds.notes:
Participate in educational training or vocational training.
Maintain fulltime employment of at least 30 hours per week.  If not employed fulltime, participate in vocational training.

May not be present where drugs are consumed, packaged for sale, or sold.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with the victims family including Donna G.

Partipate in cognitive thinking class.
Comply with all rules as set forth by agent.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Random  urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety from all illegal substances.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample unless previously submitted, pay surcharge.
Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions: firearm possession, voting.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Corren D Mattox

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with Attorney Esther Cohen Lee.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni Joseph Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is requesting sentence modification.
Arguments to the Court by the State and defense counsel.

Court finds that a new factor satisfies the modification of the sentence.  Court will modify sentence.

Court orders sentence of February 19, 2015 MODIFIED as follows:

As to COUNT 1-
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 24 YEARS, with credit for 310 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 13 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 11 YEARS.  

All other conditions to remain as ordered on February 19, 2015 and entered into the record on that date.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.

Clerk:  jms
Motion hearing scheduled for November 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Corren D Mattox not in court, in custody. 
Telephone call with Attorney Esther Cohen Lee and the deputy clerk.  Antoni Joseph Apollo, for the State of Wisconsin not in court during the telephone call.

Motion hearing was not able to be heard on October 28, 2016 as Asst. District Atty. A. Apollo was in trial on an unrelated before Hon. Judge M. Joseph Donald.

Defendant is still in the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Dept. therefore the parties are requesting the hearing be held as soon as the court's calendar allows.

Case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 28 on November 10, 2016 at 1:30 p.m.
Deputy clerk contacted the State as to the next court date.

records.addlTxt: Letter from the defendant received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Order signed and filed. Victim Impact Statement attached to this order shall not be scanned into CCAP. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.
Victim Impact Statement with attachments received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Presentence Investigation report received and filed. Parties notified. Clerk advised by the Public Defender's office that attorney Vincent Guimont will be handling this matter for the defense. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Plea hearing proceeded. Additional statements made by Angela D. Discussion regarding defense motions that were previously filed. 
Defendant sworn in. 

As to COUNT 1-
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty.  Judgment of conviction entered.
  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess any gun or other firearms. 
Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

Court also advises defendant if he is not a citizen of the United States of America, that upon a plea of guilty or no contest for this offense, he could be deported, excluded from admission to his country, or denied naturalization under federal law.  
Court advised that the defendant will have to provide a DNA sample, to the Wisconsin State Crime Laboratory for DNA testing.

Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody.  Court vacated jury trial date of 12/15/14. 
Court ordered a presentence investigation with a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed. 
 Case adjourned to Branch 25. Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for final pretrial. Parties are still in negotiations but expect the matter to resolve. Defense counsel requests short adjournment. Court grants adjournment and pre-approves the transfer of defendant's pending case in Branch 15 (14CF1646) to Branch 25 for purposes of a global resolution. If the parties do not reach a resolution, the defendant's lower pending case will be transferred back to Branch 15. Case in Branch 25 remains scheduled for jury trial on 12/15/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for December 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Motion and Motion to Suppress Defendant's Statements received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for plea hearing. Parties have not reached a resolution. Court ordered this matter set for final pretrial and jury trial dates. Defense to file motions by 9/30/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 15, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Nicole J. Sheldon on behalf of Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status conference. Attorney Johnson has recently been appointed on this matter and has not received discovery from prior counsel. State will put together a package of all the discovery for defense counsel. Defense counsel will be contacting the Milwaukee Police Department regarding a matter that has come up in this case. Defense counsel requested a projected plea date. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Richard Carpenter as a friend of the court. Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody. Antoni Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for status of counsel. Attorney Vishny of the Public Defender's Office contacted the court this morning and indicated an attorney has not been assigned in this matter yet. Court ordered this matter be adjourned for a short period of time to allow an attorney to be appointed in this matter. Court will allow ADA Apollo to appear by phone if necessary. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Certification of transcript of Motion to Withdraw proceedings; commencing 07/17/2014 received and filed. (7 Pages)
Deputy court clerk ccp.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Peter J. Kovac.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense counsel did not file a motion to suppress as originally indicated. Counsel filed a motion to withdraw as counsel today at the defendant's request. Court allowed attorney Kovac to withdraw and ordered he turn over his file to the State Public Defender's Office by 5:00 p.m. on 7/18/14. Court vacated jury trial date of 8/11/14. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Counsel's Motion to Withdraw recieved and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Proposed verdict forms received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

State's Witness List received and filed. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Peter J Kovac.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for arraignment. Original Information previously filed on 04/29/2014. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Defense counsel will be filing a motion to suppress defendant's statements. Parties to be prepared to argue any motions on the final pretrial date as well as file witness lists, motions in limine, and jury instructions. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 17, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 11, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Peter J Kovac.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Antoni J Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Erik Gulbrandson-MPD Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading.  Arraignment scheduled for May 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
No use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Corren D Mattox in court with attorney Enku E Lin.  Defendant Corren D Mattox in custody.  Michael D Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rothstein, Branch 25.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
